dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.customdata

Class DefaultHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.util.AbstractExecutableExtension
      • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.customdata.DefaultHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension

    public class DefaultHandler
extends AbstractExecutableExtension
    Default implementation to handle custom attributes. To be used in the extension point "dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.plugin.customattribute", either directly or as a base class.
    Since:
    22.0

    • Method Detail

      • getCellEditor

        public org.eclipse.jface.viewers.CellEditor getCellEditor(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
        Provides default cell editors:
        • If possible values are defined via getPossibleValues(), a combo box based cell editor is returned, which may or may not allow the input of other values (depending on allowOtherValues()).
        • If PARAM_TYPE is set to PARAM_TYPE_VAL_STRING, a text field based cell editor is returned.
        • If PARAM_TYPE is set to PARAM_TYPE_VAL_BOOLEAN, a check box based cell editor is returned.
        • Else a text field based cell editor is returned.
        May be overridden in subclasses.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent composite for the cell editor
        Returns:
        the cell editor for the custom attribute
        Since:
        22.0
        See Also:
        getPossibleValues(), AbstractExecutableExtension.getParameterValue(String)

      • getPossibleValues

        public java.lang.String[] getPossibleValues()
        Getter for the possible values for the custom attribute, if it shall support a limited set of values (see also allowOtherValues()). The default implementation interprets the parameter "possibleValues" as a comma separated list of values. May be overridden in subclasses.
        Returns:
        the string values specified as comma-separated list via the parameter PARAM_POSSIBLE_VALUES. Never null, maybe empty.
        Since:
        22.0

      • allowOtherValues

        public boolean allowOtherValues()
        To decide whether to allow other values than those from getPossibleValues(). The default implementation returns the value of the "allowOtherValues" parameter, or false if not specified by the extension point. May be overridden in subclasses.
        Since:
        22.0

      • getAttributeType

        protected java.lang.String getAttributeType()
        Returns:
        the value of the "type" parameter, or "string" if not specified by the extension point.
        Since:
        22.0

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        To decide whether a custom attribute shall be editable by the user in the UI. May be overridden in subclasses.
        Returns:
        the value of the "editable" parameter, or true if not specified by the extension point.
        Since:
        22.0

      • getDefaultValue

        public java.lang.String getDefaultValue()
        Returns:
        The default value for a custom attribute
        Since:
        22.0

      • getUIRepresentation

        public java.lang.Object getUIRepresentation(java.lang.String value)
        Returns:
        the UI representation of a custom attribute value
        Since:
        22.0
